name: See Yourself in Central Square
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

name: Mid-Cambridge Charmer - Avail for Academic Year
description: - Enjoy the comfort & convenience of my cozy 1 bedroom, on a quiet street in Mid Cambridge. With lots of light, hardwood floors, french doors, a beautiful kitchen & 2 decks. Minutes to Harvard, MIT & public transportation. Minimum stay is 4 weeks. No parking.
neighborhood_overview: Mid- Cambridge is a beautiful neighborhood of Victorian houses and tree lined streets.   Convenient to everything - half way btween Harvard & Central Sqs. Enjoy excellent dining, entertainment, site seeing & seasonal events. Everything you need is near by including grocery stores, library, post office, drug stores, cafes, banks, hubway bikes, Charles River.
host_about: Hi, I am Melissa. I grew up in historic Lexington Mass and studied Art History and Art Education. I make sculpture out of recycled computer parts out of a Maker Space called the Artisan's Asylum in Somerville and teach people of all ages. I put my heart and soul into renovating my condo and turned it into the dream home I always wanted! I love the back porch and back yard. It is the most relaxing place to hang out on a hot summer day! I rent to Harvard and MIT affiliates. Many international scholars have stayed in my condo.  Come visit MA. I live around the block and would be happy to give suggestions of what to see and do on your visit!

name: Pvt Room Heart of Harvard Square
description: ***Do not place booking request without contacting us***.A private room is available in a 2-bedroom apartment. There will be one other resident (max of 2) in the second room, and we prefer single guests for the room. In rare situations we can accept 2. The bathroom is shared with a maximum of one other guest. We are looking for very clean, professional guests only. The kitchen is shared as well. This place is not suitable for handicapped or disabled guests, and we cannot accommodate any animals
neighborhood_overview: Heart of Harvard Square. This is one phenomenal location close to everything Harvard has to offer. Most of our guests are return guests and that should speak for itself.

Harvard affiliate, design enthusiast, love to host and toast. The rest is history. Beyond all of the above, there is only one reason doing what we do- We are people's people :-).

name: Harvard/MIT/BU/Central Square Room
description:
The Room includes a Bed, Desk, closet, remote overhead dimming light, and Air conditioner.

The apartment is a 3 bedroom 1 bath on the second and third floor of a 2 family house.

When more than one guest is present, the bathroom is cleaned weekly, and the entire house is cleaned every other week.

A bike with a helmet and lock is available during your stay.

This listing is for one of the 2 rooms in the photos, not both.
host_about:
I'm a software dev who has lived in Cambridge for many years & love all my town offers

Happy to offer local recommendations:
bike trails, kayaking & other outdoor activities (especially nature outings — the Charles River is 3 blocks away!), whale watching, comedy, museums, cultural events

You're also welcome to use my fleet of renovated bikes for exploring, free of charge

I’m always reachable for anything that will make your stay comfortable

name: Victorian Charm MIT/Harvard/Kendall/Central-1BR
description: Welcome to our 100-year-old house! Cozy, friendly and full of charm. Very convenient to MGH. Our location is hard to beat: close to both subway and bus with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. Convenient for functions at MIT or Harvard. Located in Central Square, we are an easy walk to Kendall and Inman Squares. For runners and walkers, the Charles River paths are 0.5 mile away. This unit features hardwood floors and nine foot ceilings. The private back deck is very popular.
neighborhood_overview:
Despite our urban setting, our neighborhood is very quiet, particularly at bedtime. It has always been the kind of neighborhood where women can walk alone safely at night. Generally speaking, this side of the river is dramatically calmer than the Boston side though now bustling with a nice variety of great restaurants.

We actively recycle. There is a blue bin in the unit. Or, we can do it for you if you simply keep glass, plastic and metal trash together and separated from trash. We also keep a compost container in the fridge for vegetable trash. We'll empty it into the big bin outside when you leave.
host_about:
We are a pair of classical musicians in Cambridge, located between MIT & Harvard. As with much of Cambridge, we're hopeless lefties. 

On parle un peu de français. Hablamos poco español. Und ein bisschen Deutsch auch.

Most Sundays you'll find us "making a joyful noise" at one church or another.
We've been in this old house and this neighborhood over 20 years now. Since we cook a bit, the rental floor fridge and pantry might contain a little overflow from ours. We're huge fans of Airbnb both as guests and as hosts. Leave your towels and sheets at home; we provide all that for you. Our biggest challenge as Airbnb hosts is saying goodbye to the awesome people who stay with us.

name: Cambridge Apt, walk to MIT, Harvard
description: Private, sunny, top floor and a half of owner-occupied 19th century row house. The house is tucked away on a private lane minutes from Central Square and public transportation (subway and bus), restaurants, pubs, and two grocery stores. MIT is a 12-min walk, or one subway stop in one direction, and Harvard is a 20-min walk, or one subway stop, in the other direction. The flat gets lots of sun, and has a fully equipped eat-in kitchen and full bath.  No TV, but good Wifi.

name: Bright Convenient Apt Harvard / MIT
description:
This 600 sf apt with roof deck on the third floor of an old Victorian home is bright and airy. Surrounded trees it does become a sanctuary, a place to call "home". Centrally located and within walking distance to MIT, Novartis, Harvard. It is within minutes walk to the Central Sq subway, station.

The apartment is efficiently laid out with a loft feel. It has a bedroom with king size bed, bath, kitchen, and living area with a ligne roset pullout couch/bed, plus a 230 feet deck.
neighborhood_overview:
In Central Square, easy access to lots of restaurants and bars. walking distance to Inman Square, Kendall Sq, Harvard Sq. Minutes to downtown on the subway. Easy access to zip cars and hubway bicycle service. There are three grocery stores within 5 minutes, Whole Foods, H-Mart and Harvest Coop.

There are a few drinking places; the Fields, Phoenix Landing, the Druid (Inman Sq) and Plough and Stars. They all serve food.

Restaurants are also abundant. It has a concentration of ethnic restaurants. For Indian, Central Square has Shalimar, India Pavilion and many others. There is Central Kitchen, Viale, Oleana, Ole, Casa Portugal, Dumpling House (Chinese) and Four Burgers. Flour is a short walk toward MIT and is known for its baked good and breakfast.
host_about: Architect who dabbles in making things.

name: Large Bedroom + Full Private Bath
description:
A large bedroom + FULL PRIVATE bath, situated on a separate level of a newly built townhouse in the heart of Cambridge (Central Sq.) It's within walking distance of both Harvard & MIT campuses as well as numerous bars, restaurants, groceries. Ideal for those on the go who desire a prime location, quality, and a safe, quiet place to rest at night!

*Before making a reservation, message me with a bit about yourself & confirm you’ve read and understood the house rules under ‘Other details to note.’
neighborhood_overview: If you have never been to the Boston area before, Central Square is a prime location between Harvard & MIT in the heart of Cambridge. It's within walking distance from both campuses, with many bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and grocery stores (WholeFood, Trader Joe's, and H Mart) nearby.
host_about: I wear two hats in the Airbnb world: I’m both a guest and a host. Originally hailing from Toronto, Canada, I’ve been a proud resident of Cambridge, Massachusetts since 2008. As a Harvard Alumni, my adventures take me to far-flung corners of the globe. Post-COVID, I’ve embraced remote work, allowing me to operate from the cozy confines of my home. Oh, and my loyal companion? A German Shepherd who faithfully shadows my every move!

name: West Cambridge, 1 BR in House near Harvard
description:
There is 1 bedroom with 2 single beds.

The Queen Anne style house circa 1870's is in a quiet neighborhood, with pleasant walks near the Charles River. Nearby, on Concord Avenue, are buses to Harvard Square and public transport to Boston and other areas.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is residential with a mixture of families with children, Harvard students and  professional people.   Our streets are not busy except in the morning and early evening hours when there is more street traffic. There are a few restaurants and a grocery store on nearby Huron Avenue, 2 blocks away. Many more restaurants and pubs can be found on Massachusetts Avenue and in Harvard, Central, Porter and Davis Squares .   During the day, the pleasantries of hearing children when they come out for recess from the two schools a block away is a happy sound, for me anyway.  Harvard University is  on the perimeter of our neighborhood.  M.I.T and other universities are easily reached by public transportation.
host_about:
I grew up in the Boston area,  lived in Europe and many years in Argentina and still have family there.

Interests cover much from enjoyment of nature, environmental concerns, sports and cultural venues. 

Porcelain painting, writing, photography, music and theatre satisfy artistic desires.   

I enjoy traveling, interacting with people of different backgrounds and countries.  It is one of the most satisfying learning experiences.

neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport is a quiet, residential neighborhood with a lot of history. There are 5 parks within a 10 minute walk. Central Square is our closest square - a 10 minute walk north. The Charles River and BU Bridge are a 10 minute walk south.
host_about: We have lived in Cambridge MA for over 30 years. We love the New England area and embrace all four seasons as well as the food and activities that come with them. Our apartment is close to farmers' markets, interesting bars and restaurants, and public transportation to go anywhere in Boston or Cambridge. We are a 10 minute walk to the Charles River and its hike and bike paths as well as several Hubway bike rental spots. We'll happily loan you helmets! There's so much to see and do in this historic and interesting neighborhood. Come visit!

description:

neighborhood_overview: This is an old neighborhood of owner occupied homes once used as servants' quarters for the Brattle Street mansions near Harvard Square in the old, Victorian days. We neighbors all know each other, so things run smoothly. It is safe, quiet, friendly, and has GREAT coffee steps away.
host_about: Artist, textile/accessories designer, and global traveler with a particular love for Asian markets, vintage textiles, and artisans !! name: Live Large in Transformable Studio
description: A 12'x12' living room, a 12'x12' bedroom, a study, a walk-in closet, a kitchen, bathroom in a studio?    You can do it with architectural robotics.   Come experience the future of housing based on work straight out of MIT.
neighborhood_overview: Besides being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

description:

host_about:
I started teaching at MIT seven years ago and fell in love with Cambridge. My favorite things about the neighborhood are its outstanding restaurants (José's Mexican Restaurant, Gran Gusto, True Bistro and Hana Sushi are all phenomenal and within walking distance), down-the-street access to the legendary Minuteman Bikeway (if you happen to enjoy a morning walk, run or bike ride; there are 2 Hubway bike-share stations near the house), and its quiet, almost suburban atmosphere.

I love to make guests feel welcome and comfortable and to share the joys of Cambridge living.

name: Smack dab between Harvard+Porter 2
description:
The room has a double bed and is on the third floor, cozy and quiet, among the tree tops. At night you have the stars, and by day the room is light and sunny.

The room has wide, old pine board flooring, a sky light with a room-darkening shade, mini-split, closet, dresser, large desk with office supplies, yoga mat, full length mirror, and a fan.

This bedroom shares a full bathroom with the other third floor bedroom which is also rented through Airbnb.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is very special in that it is quiet, you can hear birdsong most times of the day, there are lovely gardens all around. And you will be just 3 blocks from Massachusetts Avenue (Mass Ave), the busiest street in Boston/Cambridge. Or, if you are here in winter, the quiet of the cold air is lovely too, and if we are lucky, you'll see snow!

Along Mass Ave, you can walk to many local run businesses of every sort: gift shops (Joie de Vivre, Nomad, Abodeon, Tokai), coffee shops (Simons, Hi-Rise, Starbucks) and so many restaurants of every ethnicity (Indian, Japanese, Thai, Italian, Mexican, American). You can take a walk from here to the Charles River, through Harvard Square. You can stroll down Mass Ave to Central Square where there is a whole new world waiting for you, but just as Cambridge as any other place! Somerville is just minutes away too (Davis Square, Inman Square, Union Square), and it is an amazingly rich community for music, food and funky shops
host_about:
Hello!  

I've lived in Cambridge for 38 years.  I am an artist;  I paint, draw and sculpt.   I am a rather quiet person, with a good sense of humor.   I live with two cats, Aiko and Minkah.  They are friendly and enjoy guests. 

I love living in Cambridge.  It's a rather small town with so much to offer.  Boston is also very close by, accessible by the subway, bus or Uber.  There's so much to see and do there as well!    

This is a wonderful neighborhood and I really love sharing it with people.  It is good to remember the ocean is also near by and it is accessible by subway, rail or bus.  There are countless historical sites, museums, restaurants and shopping experiences in the area.  

I hope you will consider visiting Cambridge and staying at Smack Dab!

neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is very special in that it is quiet, you can hear birdsong most times of the day, there are lovely gardens all around, lush trees and plantings and yet you will be just 3 blocks from Massachusetts Avenue (Mass Ave), the busiest street in Boston/Cambridge.  In this locale along Mass Ave, there are countless local run businesses of every sort, (gift shops (Joie de Vivre, Nomad, Abodeon, Irish and Japanese), liquor shops (University Wines), coffee shops (Simons, Hi-Rise) and countless restaurants (too many to mention) of every ethnicity.  You can take a walk from here to the Charles River, perhaps through Harvard Square.  You can stroll down Mass Ave to Central Square where there is a whole new world waiting for you, but just as Cambridge as any other place!  Somerville is just minutes away too, and it is an amazingly rich community for music, food and funky shops and cafes.  If you want to go into the Big City, hop on the red line (subway) and in minutes you will stroll
host_about:
Hello!  

I've lived in Cambridge for 38 years.  I am an artist;  I paint, draw and sculpt.   I am a rather quiet person, with a good sense of humor.   I live with two cats, Aiko and Minkah.  They are friendly and enjoy guests. 

I love living in Cambridge.  It's a rather small town with so much to offer.  Boston is also very close by, accessible by the subway, bus or Uber.  There's so much to see and do there as well!    

This is a wonderful neighborhood and I really love sharing it with people.  It is good to remember the ocean is also near by and it is accessible by subway, rail or bus.  There are countless historical sites, museums, restaurants and shopping experiences in the area.  

I hope you will consider visiting Cambridge and staying at Smack Dab!

name: Best of Cambridge! Harvard, Porter, Davis Squares
description: Comfort and Location! This charming Cambridge apartment is on the first floor of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge),  including Harvard Sq. which is 1.5 miles away. You won't need a car - we are next to public transportation to Boston, its colleges and medical centers,  and all surrounding communities.  Save significant money if you rent more than 31 days because there will be no state or local taxes.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

We also have a 3 bedroom cottage a few steps from Nantucket Sound in Harwich Port Cape Cod.  Sometimes we rent our cottage to guests in the summer months.

neighborhood_overview:
The condo is nestled in a safe and friendly neighborhood in the heart of Cambridge, MA. This prime and well-connected location, with a Walk Score of 98, offers everything you need within walking distance.

One of the main draws of Cambridge is its world-renowned universities, including Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Take a guided tour of these campuses to learn about their history, see their beautiful architecture, or explore independently.

Beyond the universities, Cambridge has several excellent museums and cultural institutions. For example, the Harvard Museum of Natural History features exhibits on everything from dinosaurs to gemstones, while the MIT Museum showcases the latest advances in science and technology. The Harvard Art Museums are a must-visit for art lovers, with collections ranging from ancient Greek pottery to contemporary paintings.

In addition to its academic and cultural offerings, Cambridge is
host_about:
Hello there and thank you for visiting my host profile!

I am a Real Estate professional living and working in Cambridge and have been an active host since 2010. 

I am passionate about traveling and love to meet new people of all cultures and backgrounds. I’m originally from Taiwan and enjoy playing music.

Feel free to book or message me first; I am more than happy to answer any specific questions you may have!

neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of diverse Inman Square, Cambridge, Massachusetts. The neighborhood is wonderful, safe and has great energy, not to mention great night life and everything you need! There are many eateries, entertainment venues and sites to visit via walking or taking public transportation. The MBTA bus system is located just outside the door. Also, Uber, Zip Car, Lyft and Hubway Bike rentals are all accessible in Inman Square.
Boston's oldest, continuously operating improvisational theater troupe, ImprovBoston is located just around the corner on Prospect Street in nearby Central Square. ImprovBoston alumni include Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me! panelist Adam Felber.
Studio200 is in a convenient location with lots to see and do with its' many world class museums, colleges and restaurants. Visit Boston's little Italy, Chinatown or the theatre district where you can take in a movie or live play at the famous Wang Centre. See the Blue Man Group.
Tour Harvard Yard a

neighborhood_overview: This is a hidden gem. Located right next to the city courthouse, our cozy neighborhood is full of tiny treasures and bits of history. You'll also find lots of great restaurants, cafés, bars, and shopping nearby.

name: Casa Paradiso - Top Floor 1bed/1bath in Cambridge
neighborhood_overview:
+Across the street is the public library, which I love to go and read or do work
+Right outside is a Little Free Library book exchange. It's an adorable place where you can take and leave books. Feel free to grab some or leave some!
+A few doors down is a bakery with the most amazing Portuguese bread I have ever tasted. I get some once a week.
+A few blocks down is a local butcher shop where I get fresh eggs and meats. If there are some in the fridge during your stay, you're more than welcome to them!
+There's a park and community pool across the street, which is fun in the summers to watch people play softball, or sit on the grass and read a book
+One of my favorite places to eat is Puritan & Company, which serves a modern twist to traditional New England cuisine
+If you're craving Tacos, there is a fab spot called the Lone Star Taco Bar. 4.5 stars, almost 900 reviews. Just saying.
+Usually known for their live music, or just a casual drink at a lo

name: BnB! Sunny private bedroom/bath near Harvard
description: A private bedroom and private bath in a BoHo style condo  located in Huron Village, a quiet, safe neighborhood in Cambridge.  A continental breakfast is included. Harvard University, Harvard Square and access to public transport (the T)  are only a  15 minute walk along beautiful historic Brattle Street. A diversity of nearby restaurants, cafes, museums, pubs, shops and music and art experiences abound.  Boston is an easy T ride away.
neighborhood_overview: If you are going to visit Cambridge or Boston, this is a great place to stay. Huron Village is a quiet neighborhood full of families, walkers, runners and bicyclists. Its safe to walk here both day and night.  You can stop for a great dinner in Harvard Square and then enjoy a leisurely walk back to Huron Village along historic Brattle street.
host_about: I am a retired science teacher and school administrator.  When I travel, I love to go on  walking holidays. Walking allows me to pay more attention to the landscape and the surrounding architecture, which I love the most.   My favorite walking holiday so far has been through Cornwall, England.  No matter where I go, I always try to seek out some good jazz - especially Latin jazz! The small local music venues are often the best.   I have always been  curious about people, who they are, where they are from and what are their life stories. I look forward to lots of interesting conversations as both a host and a guest.

You will have access to whole apartment. No Parties, No Smoking, No Pets.

Welcome to Cambridge! We look forward to hosting you and your family and friends.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is a Cultural District that is home to diversity, and world renowned universities. There are lots of events in the arts, music, and science. It is the epicenter of the tech hub, walking distance to innovation sector, biotech, research, pharma labs.
host_about:
I love to travel, cook and meet new people. A longtime Cambridge residents, and attentive host who provides the highest standards for my guests. 
You will have a personal connection, and immediate response to your needs if you book with me. If this is your first time in Boston I’m happy to give you recommendations for things to see, eat, and do in this great city. I’m an actual local resident who lives on the property, versus a corporate airbnb listing. 
Look forward to meeting you!
-Dan

Private bedroom on first floor with shared bathroom on second floor in a beautifully renovated upscale 3 story two-family home in Central Square Cambridge.

CITY OF CAMBRIDGE | Certificate of Registration | Registration No: STR-11739
neighborhood_overview:
We are a recently retired couple from MIT. We live with our cat, Isis, in a vibrant urban neighborhood steps away from the T, cafes, shops, live theater and music, and Zagat-rated restaurants. Walk 10 minutes to MIT or 20 minutes to Harvard or take the T and be in either Harvard Square or Boston in 2 minutes.

Don't know Central Square? Check out this Boston.com video on the Square: https://youtu.be/tKY42t03GMs
host_about: My name is Carolyn and my husband, Bill, and I can greet you when you arrive. We also provide a contactless check-in / stay option. Our home, our apartment and the garden have turned out to be delightful retreats in the middle of a bustling city environment.

neighborhood_overview: North Cambridge is a lovely neighborhood. Elements of the suburbs and the city combined. We are one block from the main thoroughfare but live on a quiet street. name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym, nr mit
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cheery Kendall Square furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and exquisite living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS42)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Pretty private garden-level condo+parking near MIT
description:
Walking distance of MIT/Central/Tech Square and a number of nice cafes and bars in the heart of Cambridge.
+ Recently finished modern apartment;
+ Self-checkin with a smartlock;
+ Private apartment exclusively yours;
+ Private off-street entrance;
+ On-street parking permit included;
+ Work- and laptop-friendly spaces;
+ Sparkling clean with new appliances and fixtures.
neighborhood_overview:
Walk friendly: Walking distance (12-20 mins) to MIT, Kendall square, and east and mid Cambridge. A longer walk (~1.4 mi) or short Uber/Lyft/city bus ride to Harvard.

Runner friendly: Warm up with a walk/run ~1 mile to get to the Charles river, and then run a loop taking one bridge across the river to Boston and another back to create a 3 mile or 4 mile loop (depending on the bridge), and then cool down another ~1 mile to get back home. Except the bridges, Cambridge/Boston is really flat, perfect for easy jogs.

Groceries: Multiple Whole Foods locations within ~0.6 to ~0.8 miles; Star Market ~0.6 miles away; H Mart ~0.9 miles away.
host_about: Scientist, traveler, coffee lover, fitness freak, host, and an optimist with perhaps an irrational faith in humanity.

name: Stunning urban hideaway nearby Harvard Square
description: Charming apartment in a 19th century Victorian house conserves its period architectural details in recently renovated comfort. Light streams into this en-suite guest residence through gracious windows. Beautiful cabinetry and bookcases offer some evening reading. Enjoy the marble bathroom and hardware floors and well-appointed kitchenette. A stone's throw from Porter Square, where bars, cafes, boutiques, and transportation options abound. Minutes to Harvard,  MIT and Boston.
neighborhood_overview:
Historic, posh Avon Hill neighborhood is great for walking. This part of Cambridge in general has an abundance of old Victorian homes over several square miles. The Cooper-Frost-Austin house (1681), oldest in Cambridge, is just down the street. Raymond Park and playground is nearby as well. The Harvard campus is a short distance away, and in addition to the famous yard proposes the Natural History Museum and its renowned Art Museum. Historic Cambridge Common, where General Washington's troops assembled, is nearby as well. The Porter Square subway stop is a 3-minute walk, and one stop away from Davis square or Harvard Square.

For shopping an errands, we recommend:

Porter Square Post Office
Porter Square Book store
Caffe Nero
Cafe Bourbon
The Abbey (bistro)
Bagelsaurus bakery
The Toad (cozy live music bar)
Christopher's (bistro and sports bar)
Colette Wine Bar and Restaurant
Yume Wo Katare ramen bar
Lunder Arts Cen
host_about: Marie and Andrew have been living in Cambridge for nearly twenty years. Marie grew up in the romantic city of Paris, and is now a filmmaker, script writer, and university instructor. She also loves to cook and read. Andrew hails from the south, moved to Paris to study architecture, and now runs a design and visualization practice in Cambridge. Andrew and Marie love to travel and strike up unexpected friendships.

name: Upstairs in Central Square
description: Welcome to Upstairs in Central Square! This is two bedroom apartment in the heart of Cambridge.  With an extra fold out futon bed for extra guests.  Great light on this third floor walk up that's set back a block from Mass Ave, so its surprisingly quiet.  Located right in between MIT and Harvard, in the bustling and fun Central Square, the T is a mere 30 second walk away to whisk you away to all parts Boston in minutes!
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.
host_about: Furnished Quarters has been helping people stay different for over 25 years. name: Blueground | Central Sq, doorman, nr t stop
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this studio apartment in Central Square. with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this contemporary Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, charming living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS311)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Modern Suite in Kendall/MIT
description: Right at the heart of Kendall/MIT, minutes away from the Kendall Red line and Lechmere Green line, this modern, Scandinavian inspired home is the perfect place for your Boston/Cambridge business or travel stay.  A short walk to the Charles River and the Beacon Hill area, as well as steps away from the coffee shops, great restaurants, and  bio-tech businesses of Kendall, you are in the prime location to get anywhere from MIT, Biotech and Tech companies, to Beacon Hill, and Newbury Street.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Kendall Square area, right next to MIT. From here, you can walk to the Charles River in 10 minutes and once over the bridge, you are in Boston! From the trains that are within walking distance from the house, you can easily get to Boston or Harvard Square. Additionally, you are close to Central Square, Inman Square, Cambridge Crossing, and Union Square in Somerville.

This neighborhood has a lot of amazing restaurants, cafes, breweries, and more! We are happy to share recommendations!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: 800 Square Foot, 2-bed Apt w/ AC, Laundry, Parking
description:
Large 800 square foot (75 square meter) solar powered, garden level, 2-bedroom apartment in Cambridge with private entrance, central air/heat, walk-in shower, full-size washer and dryer, kitchen, and two smart TVs with apps.

We offer free off-street parking for 1 car and are in walking distance to Davis Square (red-line subway station, restaurants and bars, shops, bowling, and theater).

The owners live upstairs and are happy to answer any questions during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
The location is great for easy access to Harvard and Tufts universities and only 5 subway stops to downtown Boston (a 13 minute ride). Massachusetts Avenue is a block away with numerous restaurants and markets.

Davis Square is a 10 minute walk away and packed with restaurants, shops, cafes, bars, clubs, a theater, bowling alley, and supermarket.

The surrounding streets are primarily residential so it's typically very quiet at night for a city. However, we're still just one block away from tons of amenities.
host_about:
We are a gay couple in our 50's splitting our time between Cambridge, Massachusetts, (Davis Square area) and our summer houses in Provincetown, MA, and near Ogunquit, ME. We rent out all three properties if you're interested in any of our listings

Our interests include travel, architecture, wine, board games and cards games, and dinners out with friends.

We lived in Tokyo, Japan, for two years and that's where we got our start using AirBnB - as hosts and guests. We've also lived in various parts of the United States; including Boston, Cape Cod, and Salem (MA), Roanoke (VA), plus San Francisco and Irvine (CA).

name: Sonder 907 Main | King Room
description: Welcome to 907 Main, a gorgeous brownstone in the heart of historic Central Square. Each space features an airy warmth with large windows and hints of exposed brick. Arriving early? We’ve provided luggage storage in the lobby. When you’re ready to explore, head to Massachusetts Avenue for local boutiques, eclectic restaurants, and buzzing taverns. And no matter where your curiosity leads, it all begins at 907 Main.
neighborhood_overview: The vibrant college town of Cambridge keeps finding ways to charm. Red brick buildings, parks and public spaces, cultural attractions, and an invigorating pace of life give the feel of a buzzing European hotspot, where an eclectic mix of young tech professionals and the lively campus communities of Harvard and MIT spill over into the area’s many restaurants, cosy bars, and craft coffee shops. Sitting along the north bank of the Charles River just a few T stops away from downtown Boston, Cambridge’s leafy, sustainably-minded neighborhoods are bursting with things to see and do for every season.
host_about: Rooms, suites, and apartments in over 40 cities around the world. Every Sonder features designer details, keyless entry, and fast free WiFi. Experience a better way to stay today.

There are several parks in the neighborhood too.

Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. description:
Kick back and relax in this lovely 2Bedroom Apartment where public transportation is easily accessible and convenient walking distance to Harvard Square and Central Square, which are local historical landmarks and where one will find plenty of stores, restaurants, pharmacies, movie theaters, etc.

You will be minutes from many colleges & universities like Harvard University, Lesley University College of Art & Science, Massachusetts Institute of Technology and many others.
neighborhood_overview:
Apartment is located in a community referred to as Cambridgeport, the beautiful Charles River sits behind the building and on weekends Memorial Drive is closed off for street festivals, bikers, boating events, etc.

Better Together is our motto and do unto others as you would like done unto you!!!

description:

At our uniquely stylish Airbnb, we are continuing to curate. Easy Commute to Boston- Steps to Red Line
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful Harvard Square Neighborhood. Steps to Harvard Law.
host_about:
Harvard affiliate, design enthusiast, love to host and toast. The rest is history. Beyond all of the above, there is only one reason doing what we do- We are people's people :-). 

★★★★★★★★

FOR NEW airbnb user, below are some of the FAQ links for your perusal (questions & answers useful for new user). Please do let me know if you have any problem, my response would be faster than airbnb support team as sometimes their hotline as very busy (but I only can help you on general question).

GENERAL FAQ for guests before booking
www.airbnb.com/help/topic/traveling

FAQ: What are Airbnb Service Fees?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/104

FAQ: For How to Book
www.airbnb.com/help/question/85

FAQ: For How to make a payment / reservation
Please message me first before you book with the number of guests including kids. Tax of 13% is added on to the total and sent. 

FAQ: For How to Contact Airbnb Support
www.airbnb.com/help/question/9

FAQ: How and when do I make a payment for my reservation?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/92

FAQ: How can I view or print a billing receipt or itinerary for my trip?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/100

FAQ: How are cleaning fees added?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/58

FAQ: How does the Airbnb payment system work?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/51

Contact Number and Email Information will only be released until a booking is made.

Below is the FAQ on airbnb “Why can’t I call or email a host before booking?”: www.airbnb.com/help/question/111

We strongly recommend reviewing all cancellation policies before making your reservations: www.airbnb.com/home/cancellation_policies

Hope this helps you get to know how airbnb works :-)

For Pricing, at the listing page, enter check in date, check out date and total number of guests. The system will auto generate the price for your consideration. Regarding the currency display, it depends on your own setting, you can change your currency setting at the lower left panel of your airbnb page under the "LANGUAGE", you will see "CURRENCY" setting. Just click on it to change to any currency that you wish to display.

- Return Customer or Host or Guest with positive reviews with whatever possible discount on top of their daily / weekly / month rate OR VIP customer that keep booking over certain accumulated nights that I will offer extra discount OR Customer who had referred me many booking :-)

name: Bright 1 BR apt for rent in Cambridge
description:
Keep it simple at this peaceful and centrally-located place. Perfect apartment to explore all that Cambridge has to offer! Windows line the entire apartment, which lends itself to a lot of beautiful light during the day. (There are shades/curtains on all windows to block out any unwanted light.) The fully-functioning kitchen opens up to the family room, allowing for concurrent cooking and conversation.

Long-term stays only (91 nights or longer).
neighborhood_overview: 5 min. walk from Central Square and 15 min. walk to Harvard Square, both of which are very vibrant. Close walking distance to Inman Square and Union Square, as well as the Charles River (great for walking & running!). Cambridge has a ton of great and varied restaurant, bar, and brewery choices and new ones are always coming!

neighborhood_overview: Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street. Much of Harvard University’s student housing is located in Riverside. Riverside is also home to some of Harvard’s academic facilities and the primary academic and administrative facility for Cambridge College Riverside is a neighborhood in Cambridge, Massachusetts with a population of 12,181. Riverside is in Middlesex County and is one of the best places to live in Massachusetts. Living in Riverside offers residents a dense urban feel and most residents rent their homes. In Riverside there are a lot of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks. Many young professio
host_about:
Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation. 
STARS offers flexible term stays in the most desirable areas around Greater Boston, Brookline, Longwood Medical Area, most major universities and Cambridge. Our units are pet friendly and accessible by public transit or order up VIP service for airport transfers, a personal driver or pet and child care. Special request? We’ll gladly check into it. We’d love to host you, just call or email us for best rates and availability. I was born and raised in Greater Boston and work in real estate in Brookline for 17 years and counting.

neighborhood_overview:
Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street. Much of Harvard University’s student housing is located in Riverside. Riverside is also home to some of Harvard’s academic facilities and the primary academic and administrative facility for Cambridge College
Riverside is a neighborhood in Cambridge, Massachusetts with a population of 12,181. Riverside is in Middlesex County and is one of the best places to live in Massachusetts. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview:

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | King Room #2
description: Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building’s rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.
host_about: Furnished Quarters has been helping people stay different for over 25 years. Driven by a passion for providing reliable short-term housing solutions worldwide, we aim to empower our guests with a seamless experience. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily.

During your stay

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Wonderful Cambridge Apt. for Short and Long Stays!
description: Spacious and relaxed, this private, 2-bedroom/5-room apartment is located on the first floor of a classic "triple decker" near Porter and Davis Squares.  The apartment has a full kitchen, living and dining room, and access to a shared laundry room. Surrounded by a native plant garden and mature trees, this is a wonderful base for exploring Cambridge's universities, or for longer, sabbatical stays. Harvard Square is one T stop away, or 10 minute by bike / 25 minutes by foot.
neighborhood_overview: This is a culturally diverse, residential neighborhood in Cambridge — located between Porter Square and Huron Village.  The apartment is a 10 minute walk to the Porter Square T station, and 15 or 25 minutes to Davis or Harvard Squares respectively. There is Blue Bike station a block away at Raymond Park, and quick access to multiple parks and green spaces in West/North Cambridge.
host_about:
I live in Cambridge, MA, with my husband, two cats and a thriving native plant garden. 
I love learning people’s stories, and exloring new places, whether distant or local. 
Our properties  are dear to our family. Two, which I share with my sister,  belonged to our vibrant mother, who was a skilled horsewoman and enlightenment seeker. ✨

name: Modern Room in Kendall/MIT near Boston & Harvard
description: Right at the heart of Kendall/MIT, minutes away from the Red line and Lechmere Green line, this modern, Scandinavian inspired home is the perfect place for your Boston/Cambridge stay.  A short walk to the Charles River and the Beacon Hill area, as well as steps away from the coffee shops, great restaurants, and  bio-tech businesses of Kendall, you are in the prime location to get anywhere from Kendall Square to Newbury Street.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Kendall Square area, right next to MIT. From here, you can walk to the Charles River in 10 minutes and once over the bridge, you are in Boston! From the trains that are within walking distance from the house, you can easily get to Boston or Harvard Square. Additionally, you are close to Central Square, Inman Square, Cambridge Crossing, and Union Square in Somerville.

This neighborhood has a lot of amazing restaurants, cafes, breweries, and more! We are happy to share recommendations!

description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one bedroom apartment in Kendall Square. . It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this fashionably Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, stylish living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.

name: Convenient Urban Room: Minutes to Harvard/MIT/MGH
description:
Welcome to your ideal urban stay in the heart of Cambridge! Enjoy unparalleled convenience with everything you need just steps away or a quick subway ride from your doorstep.

Nestled in a prime location, the room offers easy access to Porter Square (Red Line), providing seamless transit to Harvard (8 mins), MIT (14 mins), and MGH (20 mins). Lesley University, supermarkets, and an array of cafes and eateries are all within a 5-minute walk, ensuring you have everything within minutes' reach.
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Porter Square, the epitome of Cambridge charm where safety, tranquility, and convenience converge. Nestled just moments away from Harvard, MIT, and MGH, Porter Square offers a serene residential retreat with easy access to academic excellence and urban excitement. Its central location and seamless access to the Red Line subway ensure effortless exploration of downtown Boston and beyond. Enjoy the peace of mind that comes with a quiet, residential atmosphere while still being steps away from well-stocked grocery stores and an array of restaurants along the vibrant Mass Ave corridor. Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.
host_about:
I am an MIT alum and a tech entrepreneur. Having traveled and worked in many cities across continents, I've been an Airbnb host and a guest many times! 

I love to welcome people to one of my favorite cities, Boston, and show them around. Feel free to ask me any questions!

description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one bedroom apartment in Central Square. . (ID #BOS760)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | Deluxe King #17
description: Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building's rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this sophisticated one bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Cambridgeport home . (ID #BOS735)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Cambridgeport, a charming neighborhood just west of MIT’s campus. It’s a historic area known for Victorian-era homes and tree-lined streets, where the bordering Charles River adds to the neighborhood’s natural allure. In fact, Magazine Beach offers a scenic riverside escape here, making it perfect for picnics or leisurely strolls. Foodies enjoy an eclectic restaurant scene, with plenty of global cuisine, bakeries, and cocktail bars. This neighborhood perfectly balances the comforts of residential living with the vibrancy of city life. It’s a highly desirable spot just north of Boston. For those taking transportation into or out of the neighborhood, the Kendall/MIT or Central stops on the T are a just a short walk away.

Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Spacious Room | Fast Commute to Harvard, MIT, MGH
description:
Amazing location with everything within walking distance or one quick subway ride.

3 mins walk to Porter Square (red line), which leads you to Harvard (8 mins), MIT (14 mins), MGH (20 mins, door to door). 5 mins walk to Lesley University, grocery, and many eateries. Shared dine-in kitchen and bathroom (3 people max) gives you full convenience with enough privacy.
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Porter Square, the epitome of Cambridge charm where safety, tranquility, and convenience converge. Nestled just moments away from Harvard, MIT, and MGH, Porter Square offers a serene residential retreat with easy access to academic excellence and urban excitement. Its central location and seamless access to the Red Line subway ensure effortless exploration of downtown Boston and beyond. Enjoy the peace of mind that comes with a quiet, residential atmosphere while still being steps away from well-stocked grocery stores and an array of restaurants along the vibrant Mass Ave corridor. Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.
host_about: I am a digital nomad, travel tech enthusiast, having lived in US, EU, and Asia. I manage my family's units as well as my home.

name: Cambridge home near Davis, Porter, Harvard Squares
description: For June,July, and Sept. 2025: Our 3 bedroom apartment is on the 2nd and 3d  floors of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge), and Harvard Square (Cambridge). which is 1.5 miles away. No car needed - you can walk anywhere or take public transportation.  It's a 5-8 minute walk to the Davis Square subway station where you can take the Red Line to downtown Boston - a 15 minute ride. The apartment is available July 2025.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle-Eas
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

We also have a 3 bedroom cottage a few steps from Nantucket Sound in Harwich Port Cape Cod.  Sometimes we rent our cottage to guests in the summer months.

name: Your Classic Triple Decker near Harvard and MIT!
description:
Five-Star Accommodations hosted by an Airbnb SuperHost - Your comfortable oasis in a fantastic location!
Hardwood floors, exposed brick, kitchen island, radiant floor heating, and central air conditioning, just to name a few of the amenities!
A delightful spot on a quiet tree-lined street.
Easy walking distance to MIT, Harvard, Central Square T station, cafes, theater, restaurants, parks, the Charles River, and across the river to Boston!
neighborhood_overview:
Your Cambridge hub! Located in the residential Cambridge neighborhood of Cambridgeport, the apartment is a five-minute walk from Central Square where you'll find the subway as well as many restaurants and shops. Easy walk to MIT and jump on the subway to travel one stop to Harvard Square (or walk, it's just over a mile!)
Boston is just across the river. Take the Red Line subway three stops and you'll be at Boston Common.
host_about: Hello! I'm Liesl - and yes, my mother was a fan of "The Sound of Music"! Originally from New Jersey, I came to Boston for college and after a couple years living in Europe, I returned to make my home here. I've lived in Fenway, Beacon Hill, the South End and now in Jamaica Plain with my husband and two teenage sons. Many years working in the travel industry gave me a great background for my shift to  hospitality. I love working with travelers and we've had guests from all over the world - so interesting to hear your stories and what brings you to Boston. I would love to host you and give you all the inside info about what makes Boston a great place to visit!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

host_about:
Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street. Much of Harvard University’s student housing is located in Riverside. Riverside is also home to some of Harvard’s academic facilities and the primary academic and administrative facility for Cambridge College Riverside is a neighborhood in Cambridge, Massachusetts with a population of 12,181. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

description: Escape to our charming garden-level oasis in vibrant Cambridge, MA. Perfect for short-term stays, this beautifully renovated 1-bedroom, 1-bathroom unit offers comfort and convenience with a touch of urban charm. host_about: Hello! Meet Jillian & Jeremiah! As proud residents of Cambridge, MA for over a decade, we've come to adore this vibrant city and all it has to offer. name: Sunny Riverside Apt Near MIT, Harvard & Red Line
description: Welcome home to your sun-filled apartment in Cambridge’s Riverside neighborhood, just minutes from the Charles River, MIT, Harvard University, Central Square, and the Red Line.
host_about:
Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation. 
STARS offers flexible term stays in the most desirable areas around Greater Boston, Brookline, Longwood Medical Area, most major universities and Cambridge. Our units are pet friendly and accessible by public transit or order up VIP service for airport transfers, a personal driver or pet and child care. Special request? We’ll gladly check into it. We’d love to host you, just call or email us for best rates and availability.

name: Modern Studio in Charlestown, MA
description:
The nice modern studio in the Charlestown neighborhood.
The coin laundry machines are in the common basement.
Third floor. No elevator.
Quiet neighborhood with convenient access to public transportation: two subway stops to Downtown Boston.
5-min walk to T-station “Community College”, Orange Lane.
5-min walk to a plaza with “Whole Food Supermarket” and restaurants. Walking distance to the waterfront with Water Taxi and historic frigate “USS Constitution”. Close to Mass General Hospital.

name: Suite Room Near Harvard/MIT/NEU/BU/Private Bath
description:
This is a suite style room with private bathroom inside.

The room includes a King size bed, dresser, a private bathroom and a very large storage area.

It is in a 4b3b town house.
Shared kitchen, living room and a private yard are on 1st floor. Shared study room and laundry is on 2nd floor.

The wholehouse is cleaned every other week.

It’s located in a great neighborhood a few blocks from the river, MIT, Harvard, public transportation(Buses, Red Line trains), and supermarket.

- 24/7 Front Desk support
- Free Wi-Fi

name: Private 1 BDR Apt in Harvard sq
description:
This updated apartment is on the edge of Harvard Square on a very quiet and charming street. The apartment has an open floor plan with a glass door and an entire wall of windows overlooking a private patio area.

The full kitchen has everything you need to cook great meals, if that's what you are looking for, and ample storage space. You are also a few minutes walk from great restaurants or take-out.

The bathroom is spacious with a bathtub. The bedroom has closet space for two people.
host_about: A long time resident of Cambridge, I love living in this culturally diverse city right between some of the best educational institutions in the world.  Everything is a short t or walk away.  Originally from Toronto, Canada I love to travel and have enjoyed the Airbnb experience in other countries.  I am excited to now be a host and share our home with others coming to experience Cambridge.
